model.description: Vertical profile from a numerical weather prediction model including radar propagation parameters calculated from the model variables.

common_variables.name: forecast_time
common_variables.comment: For each profile in the file this variable contains the time elapsed since the initialization time of the forecast from which it was taken. Note that the profiles in this file may be taken from more than one forecast.

common_variables.name: gas_atten
common_variables.long_name: Two-way attenuation from the ground due to atmospheric gases

common_variables.name: height
common_variables.comment: The heights have been calculated using pressure, temperature and specific humidity.

common_variables.name: rh
common_variables.comment: With respect to liquid above 0 degrees C and with respect to ice below 0 degrees C. Calculated using Goff-Gratch formula.

common_variables.name: specific_dry_gas_atten
common_variables.long_name: Specific one-way attenuation due to atmospheric gases for dry air (no water vapour)

common_variables.name: specific_gas_atten
common_variables.long_name: Specific one-way attenuation due to atmospheric gases

common_variables.name: specific_liquid_atten
common_variables.long_name: Specific one-way attenuation due to liquid water, per unit liquid water content

common_variables.name: specific_saturated_gas_atten
common_variables.long_name: Specific one-way attenuation due to atmospheric gases for saturated air (saturated with respect to ice below 0 degrees C)

cpr-simulation.description: Ground-based radar measurements transformed for comparison with the 94 GHz cloud profiling radar (CPR) aboard the EarthCARE satellite.
references_html: Pfitzenmaier et al. (2025). Orbital-Radar v1.0.0: a tool to transform suborbital radar observations to synthetic EarthCARE cloud radar data. Geosci. Model Dev., 18(1), 101-115. https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-18-101-2025

dimensions.name: height_sat
dimensions.long_name: Height above mean sea level at satellite resolution

common_variables.name: vm_sat
common_variables.long_name: Convolved and integrated mean Doppler velocity

common_variables.name: vm_sat_folded
common_variables.long_name: Doppler velocity with noise, satellite motion error, and folding

common_variables.name: vm_sat_noise
common_variables.long_name: Convolved and integrated mean Doppler velocity with noise and satellite motion error

common_variables.name: vm_sat_vel
common_variables.long_name: Convolved and integrated mean Doppler velocity with satellite motion error

common_variables.name: ze_sat
common_variables.long_name: Convolved and integrated radar reflectivity factor

common_variables.name: ze_sat_noise
common_variables.long_name: Convolved and integrated radar reflectivity factor with noise

drizzle.description: Drizzle parameters such as drizzle flux and mean particle size, derived from combined radar and lidar beneath cloud base.
references_html: O’Connor et al. (2005). Retrieving Stratocumulus Drizzle Parameters Using Doppler Radar and Lidar. Journal of Applied Meteorology, 44(1), 14-27. https://doi.org/10.1175/JAM-2181.1

common_variables.name: Do_bias
common_variables.long_name: Possible bias in drizzle median diameter

common_variables.name: Do_error
common_variables.long_name: Random error in drizzle median diameter

common_variables.name: S_error
common_variables.long_name: Random error in lidar backscatter-to-extinction ratio

common_variables.name: drizzle_N_bias
common_variables.long_name: Possible bias in drizzle number concentration

common_variables.name: drizzle_N_error
common_variables.long_name: Random error in drizzle number concentration

common_variables.name: drizzle_lwc_bias
common_variables.long_name: Possible bias in drizzle liquid water content

common_variables.name: drizzle_lwc_error
common_variables.long_name: Random error in drizzle liquid water content

common_variables.name: drizzle_lwf_bias
common_variables.long_name: Possible bias in drizzle liquid water flux

common_variables.name: drizzle_lwf_error
common_variables.long_name: Random error in drizzle liquid water flux

common_variables.name: mu
common_variables.long_name: Drizzle droplet size distribution shape parameter

common_variables.name: mu_error
common_variables.long_name: Random error in drizzle droplet size distribution shape parameter

common_variables.name: v_air
common_variables.comment: Positive values are towards the sky.

common_variables.name: v_drizzle
common_variables.comment: Positive values are towards the ground.

common_variables.name: v_drizzle_bias
common_variables.long_name: Possible bias in drizzle droplet fall velocity

common_variables.name: v_drizzle_error
common_variables.long_name: Random error in drizzle droplet fall velocity

lwc.description: Liquid water content calculated using the so-called adiabatic-scaled method where microwave radiometer is used to constrain the theoretical liquid water content of observed liquid clouds.
references_html: Illingworth et al. (2007). Cloudnet. Bulletin of the American Meteorological Society, 88(6), 883-898. https://doi.org/10.1175/BAMS-88-6-883

common_variables.name: lwc
common_variables.comment:
This variable was calculated for the profiles where the categorization data
has diagnosed that liquid water is present and liquid water path is
available from a coincident microwave radiometer. The model temperature and
pressure were used to estimate the theoretical adiabatic liquid water
content gradient for each cloud base and the adiabatic liquid water
content is then scaled that its integral matches the radiometer measurement
so that the liquid water content now follows a quasi-adiabatic profile.
If the liquid layer is detected by the lidar only, there is the potential
for cloud top height to be underestimated and so if the adiabatic integrated
liquid water content is less than that measured by the microwave radiometer,
the cloud top is extended until the adiabatic integrated liquid water
content agrees with the value measured by the microwave radiometer.
Missing values indicate that either
1) a liquid water layer was diagnosed but no microwave radiometer data was
   available,
2) a liquid water layer was diagnosed but the microwave radiometer data was
   unreliable; this may be because a melting layer was present in the
   profile, or because the retrieved lwp was unphysical (values of zero
   are not uncommon for thin supercooled liquid layers)
3) that rain is present in the profile and therefore, the vertical extent of
   liquid layers is difficult to ascertain.

common_variables.name: lwc_error
common_variables.long_name: Random error in liquid water content, one standard deviation
common_variables.comment:
This variable is an estimate of the random error in liquid water content
due to the uncertainty in the microwave radiometer liquid water path
retrieval and the uncertainty in cloud base and/or cloud top height.

common_variables.name: lwc_retrieval_status
common_variables.comment:
This variable describes whether a retrieval was performed for each pixel,
and its associated quality, in the form of 6 different classes. The classes
are defined in the definition attribute. The most reliable retrieval is that
when both radar and lidar detect the liquid layer, and microwave radiometer
data is present, indicated by the value 1. The next most reliable is when
microwave radiometer data is used to adjust the cloud depth when the radar
does not detect the liquid layer, indicated by the value 2, with a value of
3 indicating the cloud pixels that have been added at cloud top to avoid
the profile becoming superadiabatic. A value of 4 indicates that microwave
radiometer data were not available or not reliable (melting level present
or unphysical values) but the liquid layers were well defined. If cloud top
was not well defined then this is indicated by a value of 5. The full
retrieval of liquid water content, which requires reliable liquid water
path from the microwave radiometer, was only performed for classes 1-3.
No attempt is made to retrieve liquid water content when rain is present;
this is indicated by the value 6.

definition.label: Value 2
definition.description: Adiabatic retrieval where cloud top has been adjusted to match liquid water path from microwave radiometer because layer is not detected by radar.

definition.label: Value 3
definition.description: Adiabatic retrieval: new cloud pixels where cloud top has been adjusted to match liquid water path from microwave radiometer because layer is not detected by radar.

definition.label: Value 4
definition.description: No retrieval: either no liquid water path is available or liquid water path is uncertain.

definition.label: Value 5
definition.description: No retrieval: liquid water layer detected only by the lidar and liquid water path is unavailable or uncertain: cloud top may be higher than diagnosed cloud top since lidar signal has been attenuated.

definition.label: Value 6
definition.description: Rain present: cloud extent is difficult to ascertain and liquid water path also uncertain.

common_variables.name: lwp_error
common_variables.comment:
This variable is a rough estimate of the one-standard-deviation
error in liquid water path, calculated as a combination of
a 20 g m-2 linear error and a 25 %
fractional error.

lidar.description: Lidars, such as ceilometers, are remote sensing devices that use laser pulses to measure the height of clouds and aerosol layers in the atmosphere.

dimensions.name: range
dimensions.comment: Distance from instrument to centre of each range bin.

common_variables.name: beta
common_variables.comment: SNR-screened attenuated backscatter coefficient. SNR threshold applied: 5.

common_variables.name: beta_raw
common_variables.comment: Non-screened attenuated backscatter coefficient.

common_variables.name: calibration_factor
common_variables.comment: Calibration factor applied.

common_variables.name: zenith_angle
common_variables.comment: Angle to the local vertical. A value of zero is directly overhead.

radar.description: Cloud radar is a remote sensing instrument that utilizes radio waves to measure the characteristics and properties of clouds, such as their size, shape, altitude, and composition.

dimensions.name: range
dimensions.comment: Distance from instrument to centre of each range bin.

common_variables.name: Zh
common_variables.comment:
Calibrated reflectivity. Calibration convention: in the absence
of attenuation, a cloud at 273 K containing one million 100-micron droplets
per cubic metre will have a reflectivity of 0 dBZ at all frequencies.

common_variables.name: v
common_variables.comment:
This parameter is the radial component of the velocity, with positive
velocities are away from the radar.

common_variables.name: zenith_angle
common_variables.comment: Angle to the local vertical. A value of zero is directly overhead.

classification-voodoo.description: The classification product calculated using VOODOO (Schimmel et al. 2022).
references_html: Schimmel et al. (2022). Identifying cloud droplets beyond lidar attenuation from vertically pointing cloud radar observations using artificial neural networks. Atmos. Meas. Tech., 15(18), 5343-5366. https://doi.org/10.5194/amt-15-5343-2022

common_variables.name: cloud_base_height_agl
common_variables.long_name: Height of cloud base above ground level

common_variables.name: cloud_base_height_amsl
common_variables.long_name: Height of cloud base above mean sea level

common_variables.name: cloud_top_height_agl
common_variables.long_name: Height of cloud top above ground level

common_variables.name: cloud_top_height_amsl
common_variables.long_name: Height of cloud top above mean sea level

common_variables.name: detection_status
common_variables.comment:
This variable reports on the reliability of the radar and lidar data
used to perform the classification.

definition.label: Value 2
definition.description: Radar echo but reflectivity may be unreliable as attenuation by rain, melting ice or liquid cloud has not been corrected.

definition.label: Value 4
definition.description: No radar echo but rain or liquid cloud beneath mean that attenuation that would be experienced is unknown.

definition.label: Value 6
definition.description: No radar echo but known attenuation.

definition.label: Value 7
definition.description: Radar echo corrected for liquid attenuation using microwave radiometer data.

common_variables.name: target_classification
common_variables.comment:
This variable provides the main atmospheric target classifications
that can be distinguished by radar and lidar.

definition.label: Value 3
definition.description: Drizzle or rain coexisting with cloud liquid droplets.

definition.label: Value 5
definition.description: Ice coexisting with supercooled liquid droplets.

definition.label: Value 7
definition.description: Melting ice particles coexisting with cloud liquid droplets.

definition.label: Value 8
definition.description: Aerosol particles, no cloud or precipitation.

definition.label: Value 10
definition.description: Aerosol coexisting with insects, no cloud or precipitation.

iwc.description: Ice water content calculated using the so-called Z-T method based on the attenuated-corrected radar reflectivity and model temperature.
references_html: Hogan et al. (2006). The Retrieval of Ice Water Content from Radar Reflectivity Factor and Temperature and Its Use in Evaluating a Mesoscale Model. Journal of Applied Meteorology and Climatology, 45(2), 301-317. https://doi.org/10.1175/JAM2340.1

common_variables.name: iwc
common_variables.comment:
This variable was calculated from the 35.5-GHz radar reflectivity
factor after correction for gaseous attenuation, and temperature taken from
a forecast model, using the following empirical formula:
log10(iwc[g m-3]) = 0.000242Z[dBZ]T[degC] + 0.0699Z[dBZ]
+ -0.0186T[degC] + -1.63. In this formula Z is taken to be
defined such that all frequencies of radar would measure the same Z in
Rayleigh scattering ice. However, the radar is more likely to have been
calibrated such that all frequencies would measure the same Z in Rayleigh
scattering liquid cloud at 0 degrees C. The measured Z is therefore
multiplied by |K(liquid,0degC,35.5GHz)|^2/0.93 = 0.944 before applying
this formula. The formula has been used where the "categorization" data has
diagnosed that the radar echo is due to ice, but note that in some cases
supercooled drizzle will erroneously be identified as ice. Missing data
indicates either that ice cloud was present but it was only detected by
the lidar so its ice water content could not be estimated, or that there
was rain below the ice associated with uncertain attenuation of the
reflectivities in the ice. Note that where microwave radiometer liquid water
path was available it was used to correct the radar for liquid attenuation
when liquid cloud occurred below the ice; this is indicated a value of 3
in the iwc_retrieval_status variable. There is some uncertainty in this
procedure which is reflected by an increase in the associated values
in the iwc_error variable. When microwave radiometer data were not available
and liquid cloud occurred below the ice, the retrieval was still performed
but its reliability is questionable due to the uncorrected liquid water
attenuation. This is indicated by a value of 2 in the iwc_retrieval_status
variable, and an increase in the value of the iwc_error variable.

common_variables.name: iwc_bias
common_variables.long_name: Possible bias in ice water content
common_variables.comment:
This variable is an estimate of the possible systematic error in 
ice water content due to the calibration error of the radar 
reflectivity factor from which it was calculated.

common_variables.name: iwc_error
common_variables.long_name: Random error in ice water content
common_variables.comment:
This variable is an estimate of the one-standard-deviation random
error in ice water content due to both the uncertainty of the retrieval
(about 1.7 dB), and the random error in radar reflectivity
factor from which ice water content was calculated. When liquid water is
present beneath the ice but no microwave radiometer data were available to
correct for the associated attenuation, the error also includes a
contribution equivalent to approximately 250 g m-2 of liquid water
path being uncorrected for.

common_variables.name: iwc_inc_rain
common_variables.comment:
This variable is the same as iwc but it also contains iwc values
above rain. The iwc values above rain have been severely affected
by attenuation and should be used when the effect of attenuation
is being studied.

common_variables.name: iwc_retrieval_status
common_variables.comment:
This variable describes whether a retrieval was performed
for each pixel, and its associated quality.

definition.label: Value 2
definition.description: Unreliable retrieval due to uncorrected attenuation from liquid water below the ice (no liquid water path measurement available).

definition.label: Value 3
definition.description: Retrieval performed but radar corrected for liquid attenuation using radiometer liquid water path which is not always accurate.

definition.label: Value 4
definition.description: Ice detected only by the lidar.

definition.label: Value 5
definition.description: Ice detected by radar but rain below so no retrieval performed due to very uncertain attenuation.

definition.label: Value 6
definition.description: Clear sky above rain and wet-bulb temperature less than 0degC: if rain attenuation is strong, ice could be present but undetected.

definition.label: Value 7
definition.description: Drizzle or rain that would have been classified as ice if the wet-bulb temperature were less than 0degC: may be ice if temperature is in error.

common_variables.name: iwc_sensitivity
common_variables.comment:
This variable is an estimate of the minimum detectable ice water
content as a function of height.

mwr.description: Microwave radiometers are instruments that measure the intensity of microwave radiation emitted or scattered by atmospheric gases and particles, providing insights into temperature, humidity, and precipitation patterns in the atmosphere.

mwr-single.description: Microwave radiometer data processed with MWRpy providing temperature and humidity profiles with high temporal resolution.
references_html: Marke et al. (2024). MWRpy: A Python package for processing microwave radiometer data. JOSS, 9(98), 6733. https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.06733

dimensions.name: time
dimensions.comment: Time indication of samples is at end of integration-time

common_variables.name: absolute_humidity_quality_flag
common_variables.comment:
0 indicates data with good quality according to applied tests.
The list of (not) applied tests is encoded in quality_flag_status

common_variables.name: absolute_humidity_quality_flag_status
common_variables.comment:
Checks not executed in determination of quality_flag.
0 indicates quality check has been applied.

common_variables.name: azimuth_angle
common_variables.comment: 0=North, 90=East, 180=South, 270=West

common_variables.name: elevation_angle
common_variables.comment: 0=horizon, 90=zenith

common_variables.name: iwv_quality_flag
common_variables.comment:
0 indicates data with good quality according to applied tests.
The list of (not) applied tests is encoded in quality_flag_status

common_variables.name: iwv_quality_flag_status
common_variables.comment:
Checks not executed in determination of quality_flag.
0 indicates quality check has been applied.

common_variables.name: lwp_offset
common_variables.long_name: Subtracted offset correction of liquid water path

common_variables.name: lwp_quality_flag
common_variables.comment:
0 indicates data with good quality according to applied tests.
The list of (not) applied tests is encoded in quality_flag_status

common_variables.name: lwp_quality_flag_status
common_variables.comment:
Checks not executed in determination of quality_flag.
0 indicates quality check has been applied.

common_variables.name: temperature
common_variables.comment: Retrieved temperature profile from single pointing measurements

common_variables.name: temperature_quality_flag
common_variables.comment:
0 indicates data with good quality according to applied tests.
The list of (not) applied tests is encoded in quality_flag_status

common_variables.name: temperature_quality_flag_status
common_variables.comment:
Checks not executed in determination of quality_flag.
0 indicates quality check has been applied.

mwr-l1c.description: Microwave radiometer data processed with MWRpy providing brightness temperature and optionally with data from infrared sensor and integrated weather station.
references_html: Marke et al. (2024). MWRpy: A Python package for processing microwave radiometer data. JOSS, 9(98), 6733. https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.06733

dimensions.name: frequency
dimensions.long_name: Nominal centre frequency of microwave channels
dimensions.comment:
1) For double-sideband receivers, frequency corresponds to the
local oscillator frequency whereas the radio frequency of the upper/lower
sideband is frequency+/-sideband_IF_separation. 2) In case of known
offset between the real and the nominal frequency of some channels,
frequency+freq_shift gives more accurate values.

common_variables.name: azimuth_angle
common_variables.comment: 0=North, 90=East, 180=South, 270=West

common_variables.name: elevation_angle
common_variables.comment: 0=horizon, 90=zenith

common_variables.name: freq_shift
common_variables.long_name: Frequency shift of the microwave channels
common_variables.comment: For more accurate frequency values use frequency + freq_shift.

common_variables.name: liquid_cloud_flag
common_variables.comment:
Flag meaning: no liquid cloud (0), liquid cloud present (1),
undefined (2)

common_variables.name: liquid_cloud_flag_status
common_variables.comment: Flag meaning: using mwr and ir (0), using mwr only (1), other (2)

common_variables.name: met_quality_flag
common_variables.comment:
0=ok, 1=problem. Note: should also be set to 1
if corresponding sensor not available

common_variables.name: n_sidebands
common_variables.comment:
0: direct-detection receivers, 1: single-sideband,
2: double-sideband. The frequency separation of sidebands
is indicated in sideband_IF_separation.

common_variables.name: pointing_flag
common_variables.comment:
Flag indicating a single pointing (staring = 0)
or multiple pointing (scanning = 1) observation sequence

common_variables.name: quality_flag
common_variables.comment:
0 indicates data with good quality according to applied tests.
The list of (not) applied tests is encoded in quality_flag_status

common_variables.name: quality_flag_status
common_variables.comment:
Checks not executed in determination of quality_flag.
0 indicates quality check has been applied.

common_variables.name: receiver
common_variables.long_name: Corresponding microwave receiver for each channel

common_variables.name: sideband_IF_separation
common_variables.comment:
For double sideband channels, this is the positive and negative
IF range distance of the two band passes around the centre frequency
(which is the LO frqeuency)

common_variables.name: zenith_angle
common_variables.comment: Angle to the local vertical. A value of zero is directly overhead.

ier.description: Ice particle effective radius calculated using the Grieche et al. (2020) method which uses Hogan et al. (2006) to estimate ice water content and alpha from Delanoë et al. (2007). In this method, effective radius of ice particles is calculated from attenuated-corrected radar reflectivity and model temperature.
references_html: Hogan et al. (2006). The Retrieval of Ice Water Content from Radar Reflectivity Factor and Temperature and Its Use in Evaluating a Mesoscale Model. Journal of Applied Meteorology and Climatology, 45(2), 301-317. https://doi.org/10.1175/JAM2340.1

Delanoë et al. (2007). The Characterization of Ice Cloud Properties from Doppler Radar Measurements. Journal of Applied Meteorology and Climatology, 46(10), 1682-1698. https://doi.org/10.1175/JAM2543.1

Griesche et al. (2020). Application of the shipborne remote sensing supersite OCEANET for profiling of Arctic aerosols and clouds during Polarstern cruise PS106. Atmos. Meas. Tech., 13(10), 5335-5358. https://doi.org/10.5194/amt-13-5335-2020

common_variables.name: ier
common_variables.comment:
This variable was calculated from the 35.5-GHz radar
reflectivity factor after correction for gaseous attenuation,
and temperature taken from a forecast model, using the following
empirical formula: log10(ier[m]) = (-0.000205 * Z[dBZ] * T[degC]
+ 0.0016 * Z[dBZ] + -0.0015 * T[degC] + -1.52)
* 3 / (2 * 917[kg/m3]). In this formula Z is taken
to be defined such that all frequencies of radar would measure the
same Z in Rayleigh scattering ice. However, the radar is more likely
to have been calibrated such that all frequencies would measure
the same Z in Rayleigh scattering liquid cloud at 0 degrees C.
The measured Z is therefore multiplied by
 |K(liquid,0degC,35.5GHz)|^2/0.93 = 0.944 before applying
this formula. The formula has been used where the "categorization"
"data has diagnosed that the radar echo is due to ice, but note
that in some cases supercooled drizzle will erroneously be identified
as ice. Missing data indicates either that ice cloud was present but it was
only detected by the lidar so its ice water content could not be estimated,
or than there was rain below the ice associated with uncertain attenuation
of the reflectivities in the ice.

common_variables.name: ier_error
common_variables.long_name: Random error in ice effective radius
common_variables.comment:
Error in effective radius of ice particles due to error propagation,
of ier = 3/(2 rho_i) IWC / alpha, using error for IWC and alpha as
given in Hogan 2006.

common_variables.name: ier_inc_rain
common_variables.comment:
This variable is the same as ier but it also contains ier values
above rain. The ier values above rain have been severely affected
by attenuation and should be used when the effect of attenuation
is being studied.

common_variables.name: ier_retrieval_status
common_variables.comment:
This variable describes whether a retrieval was performed
for each pixel, and its associated quality.

definition.label: Value 2
definition.description: Unreliable retrieval due to uncorrected attenuation from liquid water below the ice (no liquid water path measurement available).

definition.label: Value 3
definition.description: Retrieval performed but radar corrected for liquid attenuation using radiometer liquid water path which is not always accurate.

definition.label: Value 4
definition.description: Ice detected only by the lidar.

definition.label: Value 5
definition.description: Ice detected by radar but rain below so no retrieval performed due to very uncertain attenuation.

definition.label: Value 6
definition.description: Clear sky above rain wet-bulb temperature less than 0degC: if rain attenuation were strong then ice could be present but undetected.

definition.label: Value 7
definition.description: Drizzle or rain that would have been classified as ice if the wet-bulb temperature were less than 0degC: may be ice if temperature is in error.

disdrometer.description: An optical disdrometer measures the size and velocity of precipitation particles by analyzing the distortion they cause in a laser beam passing through them. These measurements can be used to derive parameters such as rainfall rate, drop size distribution, and precipitation type.

dimensions.name: velocity
dimensions.long_name: Center fall velocity of precipitation particles

categorize.description: The categorize product facilitates the application of multi-sensor algorithms by performing much of the required preprocessing. It includes radar, lidar, microwave radiometer, disdrometer and model data with regridding, correction for attenuation, reporting of measurement errors, data quality flags and categorization of targets.

dimensions.name: model_height
dimensions.long_name: Height of model variables above mean sea level

common_variables.name: Tw
common_variables.comment:
This variable was derived from model temperature, pressure and relative
humidity.

common_variables.name: Z
common_variables.comment:
This variable has been corrected for attenuation by gaseous attenuation
(using the thermodynamic variables from a forecast model; see the
radar_gas_atten variable) and liquid attenuation (using liquid water path
from a microwave radiometer; see the radar_liquid_atten variable) but rain
and melting-layer attenuation has not been corrected.
Calibration convention: in the absence of attenuation, a cloud at 273 K
containing one million 100-micron droplets per cubic metre will have
a reflectivity of 0 dBZ at all frequencies.

common_variables.name: Z_bias
common_variables.comment:
This variable is an estimate of the one-standard-deviation
calibration error.

common_variables.name: Z_error
common_variables.comment:
This variable is an estimate of the one-standard-deviation random error
in radar reflectivity factor. It originates from the following independent
sources of error:
1) Precision in reflectivity estimate due to finite signal to noise and
   finite number of pulses
2) 10% uncertainty in gaseous attenuation correction (mainly due to error
   in model humidity field)
3) Error in liquid water path (given by the variable lwp_error) and its
   partitioning with height).

common_variables.name: Z_sensitivity
common_variables.comment:
This variable is an estimate of the radar sensitivity, i.e. the minimum
detectable radar reflectivity, as a function of height. It includes the
effect of ground clutter and gas attenuation but not liquid attenuation.

common_variables.name: beta
common_variables.comment: SNR-screened attenuated backscatter coefficient.

common_variables.name: category_bits
common_variables.comment:
This variable contains information on the nature of the targets
at each pixel, thereby facilitating the application of algorithms that work
with only one type of target. The information is in the form of an array of
bits, each of which states either whether a certain type of particle is
present (e.g. aerosols), or the whether some of the target particles have
a particular property. The definitions of each bit are given in the
definition attribute. Bit 0 is the least significant.

definition.label: Bit 1
definition.description: Falling hydrometeors are present; if Bit 2 is set then these are most likely ice particles, otherwise they are drizzle or rain drops.

definition.label: Bit 2
definition.description: Wet-bulb temperature is less than 0 degrees C, implying the phase of Bit-1 particles.

definition.label: Bit 4
definition.description: Aerosol particles are present and visible to the lidar.

definition.label: Bit 5
definition.description: Insects are present and visible to the radar.

common_variables.name: insect_prob
common_variables.comment: Ad-hoc estimation of the probability that the pixel contains insects.

common_variables.name: lwp_error
common_variables.comment:
This variable is a rough estimate of the one-standard-deviation
error in liquid water path, calculated as a combination of
a 20 g m-2 linear error and a 25 %
fractional error.

common_variables.name: quality_bits
common_variables.comment:
This variable contains information on the quality of the data at each pixel.
The information is in the form of an array of bits, and the definitions of
each bit are given in the definition attribute. Bit 0 is the least
significant.

definition.label: Bit 0
definition.description: An echo is detected by the radar.

definition.label: Bit 1
definition.description: An echo is detected by the lidar.

definition.label: Bit 2
definition.description: The apparent echo detected by the radar is ground clutter or some other non-atmospheric artifact.

definition.label: Bit 3
definition.description: The lidar echo is due to clear-air molecular scattering.

definition.label: Bit 4
definition.description: Liquid water cloud, rainfall or melting ice below this pixel will have caused radar and lidar attenuation; if bit 5 is set then a correction for the radar attenuation has been performed; otherwise do not trust the absolute values of reflectivity factor. No correction is performed for lidar attenuation.

definition.label: Bit 5
definition.description: Radar reflectivity has been corrected for liquid-water attenuation using the microwave radiometer measurements of liquid water path and the lidar estimation of the location of liquid water cloud; be aware that errors in reflectivity may result.

common_variables.name: radar_gas_atten
common_variables.long_name: Two-way radar attenuation due to atmospheric gases
common_variables.comment:
This variable was calculated from the model temperature, pressure and
humidity, but forcing pixels containing liquid cloud to saturation with
respect to liquid water. It has been used to correct Z.

common_variables.name: radar_liquid_atten
common_variables.long_name: Two-way radar attenuation due to liquid water
common_variables.comment:
This variable was calculated from the liquid water path measured by
microwave radiometer using lidar and radar returns to perform an
approximate partitioning of the liquid water content with height. Bit 5
of the quality_bits variable indicates where a correction for liquid water
attenuation has been performed.

common_variables.name: rain_detected
common_variables.comment: 1 = rain detected, 0 = no rain detected

common_variables.name: v
common_variables.comment:
This parameter is the radial component of the velocity, with positive
velocities are away from the radar.

common_variables.name: v_sigma
common_variables.long_name: Standard deviation of mean Doppler velocity

classification.description: Initial classification masks from a categorize file and creates a more comprehensive classification for different atmospheric targets.

common_variables.name: cloud_base_height_agl
common_variables.long_name: Height of cloud base above ground level

common_variables.name: cloud_base_height_amsl
common_variables.long_name: Height of cloud base above mean sea level

common_variables.name: cloud_top_height_agl
common_variables.long_name: Height of cloud top above ground level

common_variables.name: cloud_top_height_amsl
common_variables.long_name: Height of cloud top above mean sea level

common_variables.name: detection_status
common_variables.comment:
This variable reports on the reliability of the radar and lidar data
used to perform the classification.

definition.label: Value 2
definition.description: Radar echo but reflectivity may be unreliable as attenuation by rain, melting ice or liquid cloud has not been corrected.

definition.label: Value 4
definition.description: No radar echo but rain or liquid cloud beneath mean that attenuation that would be experienced is unknown.

definition.label: Value 6
definition.description: No radar echo but known attenuation.

definition.label: Value 7
definition.description: Radar echo corrected for liquid attenuation using microwave radiometer data.

common_variables.name: target_classification
common_variables.comment:
This variable provides the main atmospheric target classifications
that can be distinguished by radar and lidar.

definition.label: Value 3
definition.description: Drizzle or rain coexisting with cloud liquid droplets.

definition.label: Value 5
definition.description: Ice coexisting with supercooled liquid droplets.

definition.label: Value 7
definition.description: Melting ice particles coexisting with cloud liquid droplets.

definition.label: Value 8
definition.description: Aerosol particles, no cloud or precipitation.

definition.label: Value 10
definition.description: Aerosol coexisting with insects, no cloud or precipitation.

doppler-lidar-wind.description: Wind speed and direction profiles derived from Doppler lidar scans.

weather-station.description: An automatic weather station collects real-time meteorological data, including temperature, humidity, wind speed, and precipitation.

mwr-multi.description: Microwave radiometer data processed with MWRpy providing temperature and humidity profiles with high-quality profile information.
references_html: Marke et al. (2024). MWRpy: A Python package for processing microwave radiometer data. JOSS, 9(98), 6733. https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.06733

dimensions.name: time
dimensions.comment: Time indication of samples is at end of integration-time

common_variables.name: azimuth_angle
common_variables.comment: 0=North, 90=East, 180=South, 270=West

common_variables.name: elevation_angle
common_variables.comment: 0=horizon, 90=zenith

common_variables.name: temperature
common_variables.comment: Retrieved temperature profile from multiple pointing measurements

common_variables.name: temperature_quality_flag
common_variables.comment:
0 indicates data with good quality according to applied tests.
The list of (not) applied tests is encoded in quality_flag_status

common_variables.name: temperature_quality_flag_status
common_variables.comment:
Checks not executed in determination of quality_flag.
0 indicates quality check has been applied.

categorize-voodoo.description: The categorize product calculated using VOODOO (Schimmel et al. 2022).
references_html: Schimmel et al. (2022). Identifying cloud droplets beyond lidar attenuation from vertically pointing cloud radar observations using artificial neural networks. Atmos. Meas. Tech., 15(18), 5343-5366. https://doi.org/10.5194/amt-15-5343-2022

dimensions.name: model_height
dimensions.long_name: Height of model variables above mean sea level

common_variables.name: Tw
common_variables.comment:
This variable was derived from model temperature, pressure and relative
humidity.

common_variables.name: Z
common_variables.comment:
This variable has been corrected for attenuation by gaseous attenuation
(using the thermodynamic variables from a forecast model; see the
radar_gas_atten variable) and liquid attenuation (using liquid water path
from a microwave radiometer; see the radar_liquid_atten variable) but rain
and melting-layer attenuation has not been corrected.
Calibration convention: in the absence of attenuation, a cloud at 273 K
containing one million 100-micron droplets per cubic metre will have
a reflectivity of 0 dBZ at all frequencies.

common_variables.name: Z_bias
common_variables.comment:
This variable is an estimate of the one-standard-deviation
calibration error.

common_variables.name: Z_error
common_variables.comment:
This variable is an estimate of the one-standard-deviation random error
in radar reflectivity factor. It originates from the following independent
sources of error:
1) Precision in reflectivity estimate due to finite signal to noise and
   finite number of pulses
2) 10% uncertainty in gaseous attenuation correction (mainly due to error
   in model humidity field)
3) Error in liquid water path (given by the variable lwp_error) and its
   partitioning with height).

common_variables.name: Z_sensitivity
common_variables.comment:
This variable is an estimate of the radar sensitivity, i.e. the minimum
detectable radar reflectivity, as a function of height. It includes the
effect of ground clutter and gas attenuation but not liquid attenuation.

common_variables.name: beta
common_variables.comment: SNR-screened attenuated backscatter coefficient.

common_variables.name: category_bits
common_variables.comment:
This variable contains information on the nature of the targets
at each pixel, thereby facilitating the application of algorithms that work
with only one type of target. The information is in the form of an array of
bits, each of which states either whether a certain type of particle is
present (e.g. aerosols), or the whether some of the target particles have
a particular property. The definitions of each bit are given in the
definition attribute. Bit 0 is the least significant.

definition.label: Bit 1
definition.description: Falling hydrometeors are present; if Bit 2 is set then these are most likely ice particles, otherwise they are drizzle or rain drops.

definition.label: Bit 2
definition.description: Wet-bulb temperature is less than 0 degrees C, implying the phase of Bit-1 particles.

definition.label: Bit 4
definition.description: Aerosol particles are present and visible to the lidar.

definition.label: Bit 5
definition.description: Insects are present and visible to the radar.

common_variables.name: insect_prob
common_variables.comment: Ad-hoc estimation of the probability that the pixel contains insects.

common_variables.name: liquid_prob
common_variables.comment: Probability derived from the radar data that the pixel contains liquid.

common_variables.name: lwp_error
common_variables.comment:
This variable is a rough estimate of the one-standard-deviation
error in liquid water path, calculated as a combination of
a 20 g m-2 linear error and a 25 %
fractional error.

common_variables.name: quality_bits
common_variables.comment:
This variable contains information on the quality of the data at each pixel.
The information is in the form of an array of bits, and the definitions of
each bit are given in the definition attribute. Bit 0 is the least
significant.

definition.label: Bit 0
definition.description: An echo is detected by the radar.

definition.label: Bit 1
definition.description: An echo is detected by the lidar.

definition.label: Bit 2
definition.description: The apparent echo detected by the radar is ground clutter or some other non-atmospheric artifact.

definition.label: Bit 3
definition.description: The lidar echo is due to clear-air molecular scattering.

definition.label: Bit 4
definition.description: Liquid water cloud, rainfall or melting ice below this pixel will have caused radar and lidar attenuation; if bit 5 is set then a correction for the radar attenuation has been performed; otherwise do not trust the absolute values of reflectivity factor. No correction is performed for lidar attenuation.

definition.label: Bit 5
definition.description: Radar reflectivity has been corrected for liquid-water attenuation using the microwave radiometer measurements of liquid water path and the lidar estimation of the location of liquid water cloud; be aware that errors in reflectivity may result.

common_variables.name: radar_gas_atten
common_variables.long_name: Two-way radar attenuation due to atmospheric gases
common_variables.comment:
This variable was calculated from the model temperature, pressure and
humidity, but forcing pixels containing liquid cloud to saturation with
respect to liquid water. It has been used to correct Z.

common_variables.name: radar_liquid_atten
common_variables.long_name: Two-way radar attenuation due to liquid water
common_variables.comment:
This variable was calculated from the liquid water path measured by
microwave radiometer using lidar and radar returns to perform an
approximate partitioning of the liquid water content with height. Bit 5
of the quality_bits variable indicates where a correction for liquid water
attenuation has been performed.

common_variables.name: rain_detected
common_variables.comment: 1 = rain detected, 0 = no rain detected

common_variables.name: v
common_variables.comment:
This parameter is the radial component of the velocity, with positive
velocities are away from the radar.

common_variables.name: v_sigma
common_variables.long_name: Standard deviation of mean Doppler velocity

common_variables.name: width
common_variables.comment:
This parameter is the standard deviation of the reflectivity-weighted
velocities in the radar pulse volume.

der.description: Liquid droplet effective radius using the Frisch et al. (2002) method based on radar reflectivity factor and microwave radiometer liquid water path.
references_html: Frisch et al. (2002). The Retrieval of Stratus Cloud Droplet Effective Radius with Cloud Radars. J. Atmos. Oceanic Technol., 19(6), 835-842. https://doi.org/10.1175/1520-0426(2002)019%3C0835:TROSCD%3E2.0.CO;2

common_variables.name: N_scaled
common_variables.comment:
From scaled Frisch method the cloud droplet number concentration
can be derived.

common_variables.name: der
common_variables.comment:
This variable was calculated for the profiles where the categorization
data has diagnosed that liquid water is present the cloud droplet
effective radius is calculated after Frisch et al (2002), relating Z
with def by assuming a lognormal size distribution its width and the
number concentration of the cloud droplets.

common_variables.name: der_error
common_variables.long_name: Absolute error in droplet effective radius
common_variables.comment:
This variable is an estimate of the random error in effective
radius assuming an error in Z of ddBZ = 2.0 in N of
dN = 200000000.0 and in the spectral width dsigma_x = 0.1
and in the LWP Q of 0.005 kg m-3.

definition.label: Value 2
definition.description: Mix of drops and ice: Droplets and ice crystals coexist within pixel. Z may be biased by large crystals.

definition.label: Value 3
definition.description: Precipitation in profile: Drizzle and rain affects LWP retrieval of MWR but also the target reflectivity.

definition.label: Value 4
definition.description: Surrounding ice: Less crucial! Ice crystals in the vicinity of a droplet pixel may also bias its reflectivity.

common_variables.name: der_scaled
common_variables.comment:
This variable was calculated for the profiles where the
categorization data has diagnosed that liquid water is present
the cloud droplet effective radius is calculated after
Frisch et al. (2002), relating Z with def by assuming a lognormal
size distribution and its width. The number concentration required
to represent the size distribution is derived by scaling the LWP
 measured with microwave radiometer over the observed (single) cloud layer.

common_variables.name: der_scaled_error
common_variables.long_name: Absolute error in droplet effective radius (scaled to LWP)
common_variables.comment: This variable was calculated for the profiles where the categorization data

rain-radar.description: Micro Rain Radar (MRR) is a remote sensing instrument used for measuring the vertical profiles of precipitation intensity and particle size distribution in the atmosphere.

dimensions.name: range
dimensions.comment: Distance from instrument to centre of each range bin.

common_variables.name: Zh
common_variables.comment:
Calibrated reflectivity. Calibration convention: in the absence
of attenuation, a cloud at 273 K containing one million 100-micron droplets
per cubic metre will have a reflectivity of 0 dBZ at all frequencies.

common_variables.name: v
common_variables.comment:
This parameter is the radial component of the velocity, with positive
velocities are away from the radar.

common_variables.name: width
common_variables.comment:
This parameter is the standard deviation of the reflectivity-weighted
velocities in the radar pulse volume.

common_variables.name: zenith_angle
common_variables.comment: Angle to the local vertical. A value of zero is directly overhead.

doppler-lidar.description: Attenuated backscatter coefficient and Doppler velocity profiles measured by a vertical-pointing Doppler lidar.

rain-gauge.description: A rain gauge is an instrument designed to measure accumulated rainfall.

common_variables.name: rainfall_amount
common_variables.comment: Cumulated precipitation since 00:00 UTC
